12:15.race_name: Watch The Unibet Racing Postcast Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Something to find on Newbury effort but Flat form suggests he should improve
runners.name: Contacto
runners.owner: Elb Bloodstock Ltd And R L Banks
runners.spotlight: Jumped novicey on his way to finishing fourth at Newbury (2m) on hurdles/stable debut; something to find on that effort but Flat form (fairly useful) suggests he should do better.

runners.comment: Quite a useful handicapper on Flat for George Boughey; hurdles debut
runners.name: Fouroneohfever
runners.spotlight: Quite a useful middle-distance handicapper on the Flat for George Boughey, winning four times; the only hurdles debutant in the field, so the betting may give further guidance.

runners.comment: Brings the worst form
runners.name: Golly Gosh
runners.spotlight: Soundly beaten in bumper and 2m4f maiden hurdle; brings the worst form.

runners.comment: Needs improvement on the figures; may find his feet when qualified for handicaps
runners.name: Night Ride Home
runners.owner: M Buckley, C Noell And M Hankin
runners.spotlight: Represents notable connections but hasn't made much of a splash yet and needs improvement on bare figures; 25-1 shot last time and may find his feet when qualified for handicaps.

runners.comment: Solid second (form has substance) in two races at Newbury for new yard; leading claims
runners.name: Sinnatra
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner for Paul Nicholls; solid second in maiden hurdles at Newbury (2m, soft/good to soft; form has substance) for new stable, clear of the remainder latest occasion; leading claims.

runners.comment: Modest claims on Flat and hurdles form
runners.name: Nelson Gate
runners.spotlight: Maiden who has modest claims on Flat and hurdles form; well beaten at Newbury last time.

runners.comment: Promising second in sole French start and over C&D; looks a winner waiting to happen
runners.name: Pourquoi Pas Papa
runners.spotlight: Has shown clear promise with second-place finishes in sole French start (subsequently sold for 200,000euros) and over C&D, both against his own age group; looks a winner waiting to happen.

12:45.race_name: Try Unibet's Smartview Racecards Handicap Chase (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Front-runner who posted an impressive performance over C&D last time; respected
runners.name: Keep Running
runners.spotlight: Front-runner who posted an impressive performance over C&D (good to soft) most recently, looking better than ever and taking chase record to 4-12; respected with an 11lb rise plausibly surmountable.

runners.comment: Scored by 7l at Ascot most recently and looks open to further improvement
runners.name: Vanderpoel
runners.spotlight: Has an overall record of 4-8 and form figures of 321 since switched to chasing, scoring by 7l in novice handicap at Ascot (2m1f, soft) most recently; open to further improvement and has major claims.

runners.comment: Consistent in completed starts since wind surgery; also declared 12:27 Wincanton
runners.name: Gabriels Getaway
runners.spotlight: Unseated rider early at Kempton last week; consistent otherwise (224) since having wind surgery and should give his running provided he gets round; also declared 12.27 Wincanton.

runners.breeder: S C P Haras Des Coudraies
runners.comment: Has lacked fluency this term, last time in cheekpieces; now blinkered
runners.name: Kotmask
runners.spotlight: Has lacked fluency and failed to pick up a head of steam this term, most recently in cheekpieces; on a handy mark but chance depends on whether the switch to blinkers helps.

runners.comment: Scored readily at Plumpton, taking chase record to 4-6; improving sort
runners.name: Siam Park
runners.spotlight: Second-season chaser who scored readily at Plumpton (2m1f, good) most recently, taking record in this sphere to 4-6; improving sort who receives plenty of weight all round upped in grade.

13:15.race_name: Try Unibet's Acca Boosts Seniors' Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Absent since placed on handicap debut in December 2023 and tricky to weigh up at present
runners.name: North Lodge
runners.owner: Mcneill Family & Exors Of Late N Farrell
runners.spotlight: Very lightly raced 9yo who was a Grade 2 novice winner in 2022, but has been absent since placed on handicap debut at Newbury (2m4f, good to soft) in December 2023; current ability tricky to gauge.

runners.comment: Out of form last season and finished down the field on last month's stable debut
runners.name: Stolen Silver
runners.spotlight: Smart chaser in his prime but out of form during light campaign for Sam Thomas last season and well down the field in 3m Cheltenham hurdle for new stable last month; drops back in trip here; revival needed.

runners.comment: Returned from long absence with disappointing run in November; others are less risky
runners.name: Sonigino
runners.owner: Sir A Ferguson, G Mason, L Hales, The Late J Hales
runners.spotlight: Ended 2023-24 season in poor form and returned from long absence with another disappointing run in November (stopped quickly); this race is easier but he needs to prove some ability remains.

runners.comment: Would probably prefer a stiffer stamina test but runs this track well; enters calculations
runners.name: Henri The Second
runners.spotlight: Didn't jump well enough when safely held in small-field chase on seasonal debut in November, but runs this track very well and is well handicapped if judged on last-season's wide-margin success here (2m7f, heavy); would appeal more over further and/or on slower ground but still considered.

runners.comment: Rewarded persistent ride when staying on strongly to win by over 8l at Exeter in November
runners.name: Luttrell Lad
runners.spotlight: Rewarded some persistence from Alice Stevens when keeping on strongly from poor position to win by over 8l at Exeter (2m2f, good to soft) six weeks ago; it's hard to know what to make of that performance and he's 6lb higher here, but it's easy to spot the logic behind moving him back up in trip and keeping him on a stiff track.

runners.comment: Consistent 9yo; ran well in defeat last time and has very good record over C&D; big player
runners.name: Bourbali
runners.owner: W Pope, E Legg, M Green & T Swaffield
runners.spotlight: Consistent 9yo who mixes chasing with hurdling; gave good account when clear second on slower-than-ideal ground over hurdles at Plumpton (2m4f, soft) last month and has a very good record over this C&D; big player.

runners.comment: On a good mark but was out of form at end of last year and is best at around 3m
runners.name: Secret Trix
runners.spotlight: Six-time hurdle winner (2m7f-3m, good-soft); lurks on a good mark but ended last year with some below-par efforts and today's drop back in trip is not ideal.

runners.comment: Fell in a chase on seasonal debut and didn't really fire when back over hurdles last time
runners.name: Range
runners.spotlight: On a workable mark and will be suited by today's trip-and-ground combination, but fell in a chase on seasonal debut in October and was about 23l behind Luttrell Lad when well-held fourth over hurdles at Exeter (2m2f, good to soft) in November; needs to get back on track.

runners.comment: Low-mileage 9yo; given wind op after seasonal debut in November; still unexposed over 2m4f
runners.name: Dominics Fault
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 9yo with 2-7 strike-rate over hurdles; didn't find much for pressure when midfield in good Newbury handicap on seasonal debut in November but was given a wind op soon afterwards and now sports a tongue-tie; still unexposed at around 2m4f; high on the list.

runners.comment: Comfortably too good for very progressive rival on latest hurdling start in October
runners.name: Poncho
runners.spotlight: Won on the Flat in October and was too good for very progressive rival over hurdles at Plumpton (2m, good) in November; safely held in valuable series final on the Flat since but could have untapped potential over this sort of trip over hurdles.

runners.breeder: E A R L Du Bois Hue
runners.comment: Not beaten far at Ascot last month but 3lb wrong here; others appeal more
runners.name: Lucky One
runners.spotlight: Returned from break with fairly good third at Newton Abbot (2m1f, good to soft) in October and wasn't beaten far when midfield at Ascot (2m5f, soft) last month, but this generally regressive 11yo is 3lb wrong here and others appeal more.

13:50.race_name: Unibet Middle Distance Veterans' Handicap Chase (Unibet Middle Distance Veterans' Chase Qualifier)

runners.comment: Scored comfortably at Leicester most recently and warrants respect
runners.name: Jet Plane
runners.spotlight: Has gradually readjusted to handicap level, following a spell in hunter chases, and scored comfortably at Leicester (2m4f, good) most recently; respected despite being on a career-high mark.

runners.comment: Has become an all-or-nothing type and comes with risks
runners.name: Numitor
runners.owner: Paul G Jacobs And Wetumpka Racing
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful but has become an all-or-nothing type, with last eight appearances comprising three wins and five pulled-ups; had wind surgery (his second) since last run; comes with risks.

runners.comment: Has shown best chase form on sharp/flat tracks; others preferred
runners.name: Hurricane Bay
runners.spotlight: Has shown best chase form, namely two wins, on sharp/flat tracks; folded tamely in latest outing and suffered a heavy defeat in sole Sandown attempt; not the percentage call.

runners.comment: Remains in form and is still well treated on historical data; in the mix
runners.name: Triple Trade
runners.spotlight: Ran respectably last time when bidding for a Cheltenham (2m) double; remains in form, stays 2m4f and is still well treated on historical data (has defied higher marks); in the mix.

runners.comment: Regained the winning thread in similar event at Cheltenham last time; big player
runners.name: Can You Call
runners.spotlight: Belatedly regained the winning thread in similar event at Cheltenham (2m4f, good to soft) last time and did it in a manner that suggests he'll cope with going back up 7lb; major contender.

runners.comment: Seems past his best, notwithstanding a hunter chase win on last appearance
runners.name: Minella Trump
runners.spotlight: Well treated on peak handicap form but he's a 12yo now and seems past his best, notwithstanding a hunter chase win at Carlisle (2m5f, good) on last appearance ten months ago.

runners.comment: Generally progressive; has form figures of 311 at Listed level; leading claims
runners.name: Jubilee Alpha
runners.spotlight: Almost 8l behind Nurse Susan in Cheltenham handicap most recently, but gets a 12lb pull on these terms; generally progressive otherwise and has form figures of 311 at Listed level, most recently winning at Cheltenham (2m4f, good) last April; leading contender.

runners.breeder: S C E A De La Chaussee
runners.comment: Gained her last win over C&D but has the worst chance at the weights
runners.name: Good Look Charm
runners.owner: The Isle Of Blue And White
runners.spotlight: Gained her last success over C&D but that was in a handicap off a mark of only 115; below form since and has the worst chance at the weights in this field; visor added.

runners.comment: Bounced back to form with Cheltenham win last time; one of the main players
runners.name: Nurse Susan
runners.spotlight: Lightly raced 9yo; bounced back to form in mares' handicap at Cheltenham (2m4f, good to soft) last time, adding to her 2023 success in the same race and taking career record to 5-11; worse off with Jubilee Alpha in this rematch but is one of the main players.

runners.comment: Looks held by Sunset Marquesa on C&D running last time
runners.name: Shantwopointfive
runners.spotlight: Won at Cartmel early in season; ran creditably behind easy winner Sunset Marquesa in C&D handicap most recently, but a 5lb pull doesn't look enough to turn the tables and this is a stiffer task.

runners.comment: Scored easily in C&D handicap last time and looks open to further improvement
runners.name: Sunset Marquesa
runners.spotlight: Easily justified favouritism in mares handicap' over C&D (soft) last time, building on her reappearance effort and taking hurdles record to 3-7; had Listed form in bumpers and looks interesting returned to this level, with further improvement plausible.

runners.comment: Good second in Grade 2 over C&D and Grade 1 at Fairyhouse last term; respected
runners.name: Thatll Do Moss
runners.spotlight: Below par in similar event at Kempton on reappearance but largely progressive otherwise and may rebound with that outing under her belt; good second in Grade 2 over C&D and Grade 1 at Fairyhouse (2m4f) as a novice hurdler last term; respected.

15:05.race_name: Unibet Veterans' Handicap Chase (2025 Stayers' Veterans' Chase Final)

runners.comment: Bagged a couple of veterans' events last year, including off current mark; good chance
runners.name: Le Milos
runners.spotlight: Landed the Coral Gold Cup in 2022 and bagged a couple of veterans' events last year, the latest comfortably off current mark at Fakenham (3m, good) in May; good chance provided he's back in similar form.

runners.comment: Made all in notable handicap at Wincanton in sole start this term; commands respect
runners.name: Gustavian
runners.spotlight: Made all in notable handicap at Wincanton (3m1f, good; off 8lb lower) in sole start this term, belatedly doubling his chase tally; retains plenty of ability and commands respect back in a veterans' contest.

runners.comment: Won going away at Warwick in a leg of this series last time; still unexposed over 3m
runners.name: Nocte Volatus
runners.spotlight: Won going away at Warwick (3m, good to soft; career-best performance) in a leg of this series last time, taking chase record to 6-24 and setting him up perfectly for a crack at this final; remains unexposed at this distance; major claims.

runners.comment: Successful off this mark in this race 12 months ago when it was moved to Market Rasen
runners.name: Copperhead
runners.spotlight: Record of 7-27 over fences features a win off this mark in this race 12 months ago when it was moved to Market Rasen (3m, good to soft); possibilities with Cheltenham reappearance under his belt.

runners.comment: Needs a marked turnaround, having posted form figures of PPP last term
runners.name: Blackjack Magic
runners.spotlight: Defied current mark in notable handicap at Wincanton in 2023 but needs a marked turnaround on seasonal debut, having posted form figures of PPP last term; best watched unless the market speaks positively.

runners.comment: Regained the winning thread at Ludlow last time; still well treated on historical data
runners.name: Annsam
runners.spotlight: Belatedly regained the winning thread at Ludlow (3m1f, good to soft) last time and, despite going back up 5lb, remains well handicapped on historical data (has defied higher marks); not dismissed.

runners.comment: Has a record of 2-4 in visor and looks interesting with the headgear reapplied
runners.name: Credo
runners.spotlight: Not disgraced in two runs this term; has a record of 2-4 in visor, the wins at Exeter and Carlisle last February/March in legs of this series, both under Harry Cobden; interesting with the headgear reapplied.

runners.comment: Possibly needed latest run (stable debut); well treated on best Irish form
runners.name: Gabbys Cross
runners.spotlight: Well behind Nocte Volatus at Warwick on debut for new stable, extending his long losing spell, but possibly needed the run; well treated on best Irish form, notably a Galway win off a higher mark in 2022.

runners.comment: Irish jumper; last of four finishers returned to fences most recently
runners.name: Digby
runners.spotlight: Irish jumper whose form (hurdles/fences) has gone rather pear-shaped since a good spell last April-June; last of four finishers returned to this sphere most recently and needs to raise his game.

15:35.race_name: Read Nicky Henderson's Unibet Blog Handicap Hurdle (Challenger Two Mile Hurdle Series Qualifier)

runners.comment: Something possibly amiss last time; progressive sort otherwise and has won over C&D
runners.name: Nardaran
runners.spotlight: Left impression something was amiss last time; progressive sort otherwise and comfortably justified favouritism over C&D (good to soft) earlier in November, following up his reappearance win; remains of interest.

runners.comment: Good second in notable handicap at Ascot most recently; major player back down in class
runners.name: Hot Fuss
runners.spotlight: Scored over C&D and ran well at the Cheltenham Festival as a juvenile hurdler last term; good second in notable handicap at Ascot (1m7f, good to soft) most recently; major contender back down in grade.

runners.comment: Good second at Sandown (behind Nardaran) and Cheltenham the last twice; in the mix
runners.name: Continuance
runners.spotlight: Scored three times as a juvenile hurdler last season; threatening to add to his tally, having finished a good second at Sandown (behind Nardaran) and Cheltenham the last twice; in the mix.

runners.comment: Absent since last April but has won when fresh; 3-6 over hurdles and may progress further
runners.name: Imaginarium
runners.spotlight: Lacks recent match practice, having been absent since Perth win (2m) last April, but has scored when fresh; 3-6 over hurdles and may be capable of better still; market support would heighten interest.

runners.comment: Finished strongly and nearly collared Dance And Glance at Ascot on debut for new stable
runners.name: All In You
runners.spotlight: Dual Flat/hurdles winner in France; finished strongly and nearly collared Dance And Glance at Ascot (1m7f, soft) on stable/seasonal debut; clear possibilities, provided he builds on that effort.

runners.comment: Generally consistent; held on narrowly from All In You at Ascot most recently; solid
runners.name: Dance And Glance
runners.spotlight: Generally consistent sort who held on narrowly from the fast-finishing All In You at Ascot (1m7f, soft) most recently, taking record to 4-11; again holds solid claims and likely to remain competitive.

runners.comment: Skelton runner who remains open to improvement and is interesting back down in trip
runners.name: Brace For Landing
runners.owner: Robert Kirkland And Neil & Alfie Smith
runners.spotlight: Failed to get home over 2m4f at Newcastle last time on handicap debut and second British start; this Skelton runner remains open to improvement and is interesting back down in trip; headgear applied.

runners.comment: May struggle to reverse last-time Ascot placings with two of these rivals
runners.name: Hes A Latchico
runners.spotlight: Ran well behind Dance And Glance and All In You at Ascot when bidding to follow up his Leicester win; however, may struggle to reverse the placings with those younger rivals who both have lower mileage.

runners.comment: Proved he retains a big chunk of ability when winning at Cheltenham in November
runners.name: Eldorado Allen
runners.spotlight: Long in the tooth now and not the force of old but proved he still retains a big chunk of ability when winning veterans' chase at Cheltenham (2m4f, soft) in November, and his third there (2m4f, good to soft) last month was perfectly respectable.

runners.comment: Below form on both outings last season and again disappointing when returning in November
runners.name: Outlaw Peter
runners.owner: The Stewart Family, Dench, Ferguson & Mason
runners.spotlight: Not at best on either start during very light campaign last season and disappointed when last of three on reappearance outing at Newbury in November; well handicapped on old form and has conditions to suit here but arrives with a point to prove.

runners.comment: Suffered early mishap last week but was in good form in the autumn; good chance
runners.name: Gabriels Getaway
runners.spotlight: Returned from break with three creditable efforts this autumn, most notably when close second in valuable Ascot handicap (2m1f, good) on second occasion; suffered early mishap at Kempton a week ago but should be fine over today's longer trip and has a good chance here if all goes to plan; usually ridden very patiently; also declared 12.45 Sandown.

12:57.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Mares' Novices' Hurdle (Herring Queen Qualifier) (GBB)

runners.comment: Scored on hurdle debut at Worcester in the autumn and is a leading contender here
runners.name: No Tricks At All
runners.owner: M V Magnier, Mrs P Shanahan & Dash Grange Stud
runners.spotlight: Just a respectable fourth on bumper debut in the spring but improved to cause 18-1 surprise on hurdle debut at Worcester (2m, good) in October, form that has been boosted by the runner-up since; leading contender.

runners.comment: Well beaten at huge odds on last month's seasonal/hurdle debut at Exeter
runners.name: Deauville Lady
runners.spotlight: Well beaten at huge odds on last month's seasonal/hurdle debut at Exeter (2m, good to soft); this race is much easier but she still can't be recommended.

runners.comment: Not beaten far in two Taunton novice races towards end of last year; place claims
runners.name: Lydeard Girl
runners.spotlight: Unable to land a telling blow in two 2m Taunton novices (both on good) towards end of last year but wasn't beaten that far on either occasion and has a chance to collect a minor prize here.

runners.comment: With good stable but was well beaten on bumper debut last January
runners.name: Miss Macaroni
runners.spotlight: With a good stable but beat only one home in 16-runner Doncaster bumper (good to soft) on debut last January and needs to be a completely different proposition on this first run since.

runners.comment: Dual Irish point winner; safely held in two bumpers; may fare better now hurdling
runners.name: Shes Delighted
runners.spotlight: Dual Irish point winner in the spring (yielding/good); made low-key start to rules career when beaten about 10l in two autumn bumpers (good/soft) but is open to improvement over hurdles.

runners.comment: Placed in a point bumper last April but soundly beaten in a rules bumper in May
runners.name: Silver Gale
runners.spotlight: Kept on well for third in fast-ground point bumper in April but was soundly beaten in a rules bumper at Worcester (good) the following month.

runners.comment: Shaped with clear promise before fading into fourth on hurdle debut; must be considered
runners.name: Yeld To Call
runners.spotlight: Made the frame in both bumpers and again displayed significant promise on hurdling debut at Warwick (2m3f, good to soft) in November, when she made a big forward move from the rear to press the winner on the home turn before fading into fourth; had wind surgery soon afterwards and drops back in trip here; might be the answer.

13:30.race_name: Bet £10 Get £40 With BetMGM Handicap Chase (Challenger Staying Chase Series Qualifier) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Muted this season; switches to first-time visor (from cheekpieces) and dropped in class
runners.name: Transmission
runners.spotlight: Competitive off this sort of mark at Cheltenham (3m+) last season but not on his first two starts this campaign and he was never dangerous at Ascot on third attempt; has worn cheekpieces for over two years but now switches to first-time visor in revival bid; also dropped in class.

runners.comment: 2nd twice last May but lesser displays since are a worry; connections turn to cheekpieces
runners.name: Tommie Beau
runners.spotlight: Winner of the Durham National and Southern National in 2023 and scored three times in summer 2024; runner-up twice last May but the lesser displays since are a worry; this is his lowest mark since October 2023 and connections turn to cheekpieces.

runners.comment: Raised 6lb after Doncaster win and now goes right-handed but he should have more to give
runners.name: Silver Thorn
runners.spotlight: Wind surgery after final start last term; sent chasing this season, well beaten on return but making most to win easily at Doncaster (3m, good to soft) three weeks ago, 1l ahead when left clear at the last; raised 6lb and right-handed track might ask a question but he should have more to give.

runners.comment: Made most to win seasonal/chase debut at Taunton (3m, good to firm) in November; up 3lb
runners.name: Wicked Thoughts
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 7yo who made most and held on well to make a winning seasonal/chase debut at Taunton (3m, good to firm) in November; raised only 3lb and should have more to offer.

runners.comment: 20-1 when pulled up on chase/seasonal debut; can still prove capable of better
runners.name: Tommy The Tank
runners.spotlight: Considerable promise during last season's novice hurdle campaign, making all at Hereford (3m2f, good to soft; by 13l from Wicked Thoughts) in February; two poor results since may well be forgivable, the latter on handicap/chase debut at Sandown four weeks ago when he was 20-1 and should have benefited from the run; strong feeling persists that he will prove capable of better.

runners.comment: Highly competitive in two of his three starts this term, the exception on heavy ground
runners.name: Kelce
runners.spotlight: Often front-runner; progressive over fences last season (wins on soft/good) and highly competitive in two of his three starts this term, the exception on heavy ground; another bold show is likely.

runners.comment: Two wins in autumn 2024 but in and out since; blinkers are now enlisted
runners.name: Vision De Maine
runners.spotlight: Chase career began with two wins in autumn 2024 (3m/2m7f, good to soft/good) but in and out since; the disappointment on latest start was admittedly on heavy going; blinkers (he has tried cheekpieces) are now enlisted.

14:05.race_name: Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Ran okay two starts ago and had ground excuse last time but others appeal more
runners.name: Teorie
runners.spotlight: Rebounded from two poor runs (one on the Flat) with respectable fifth at Worcester (2m4f, good) in September and probably wasn't suited by the soft ground when below that form over C&D last month but others in this line-up have more pressing claims.

runners.comment: Irish point winner; placed on two of three hurdling starts; can improve in handicaps
runners.name: Purple Owl
runners.spotlight: Fast-ground Irish point winner who was placed on two of his first three hurdling starts, more recently after making the running at Uttoxeter (2m, soft; first-time tongue-tie) last month; back on quicker ground for this handicap debut and open to improvement.

runners.comment: Probably ended up with too much to do at Chepstow last week; current mark is workable
runners.name: Knight Templar
runners.spotlight: Just 1-7 over hurdles but his close third off 3lb higher at Exeter (2m, good to soft) in November was a good effort and he probably ended up with a too much to do when fifth at Chepstow (2m, good to soft) a week ago; could have a say.

runners.comment: Showed promise on first three hurdling runs; unlucky to come to grief on handicap debut
runners.name: Sea Warrior
runners.spotlight: Showed promise on first three hurdling starts (2m-2m3f) and was unlucky to come to grief mid-race over C&D on last month's handicap debut; remains unexposed.

runners.comment: Ended last year with two good runs at Taunton and is eased in grade here; respected
runners.name: Him Malaya
runners.spotlight: Ended last year with two good runs under Olive Nicholls at Taunton, the latter a keeping-on fourth in 0-130 grade (2m3f, good); also suited by this C&D and has a big role to play at this lower level.

runners.comment: Bumper winner who was placed on first three starts over hurdles; handicap debut today
runners.name: Three Pikes
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner who was placed on first three starts over hurdles; slightly disappointing when third at Uttoxeter (2m4f, good) in September but the form of his two previous runs worked out reasonably well; drops back in trip for handicap debut; no surprise if he features.

runners.comment: Didn't get home on heavy ground last time; form of previous Kempton sixth reads well
runners.name: Raffles Nobu
runners.spotlight: Bettered low-key seasonal/stable debut when respectable sixth at Kempton (2m, good; form has worked out well) in November; didn't get home after travelling well on heavy ground last month but has slipped a tempting mark and enters calculations.

runners.comment: Not suited by 2m4f on good to soft last time; better judged on earlier good-ground C&D win
runners.name: Western Soldier
runners.spotlight: Buit upon pleasing reappearance run when winning in pretty good style over C&D (good) in November; well held when second of three here (2m4f, good to soft) last month but today's trip-and-ground combination will suit him better and he remains of interest.

runners.comment: Juvenile who came good over hurdles at Taunton last month; open to further improvement
runners.name: Premier
runners.spotlight: Fair Flat racer who came good over hurdles at fourth attempt, battling well for narrow success at Taunton (2m, good) last month; 8lb higher here but could still have more to offer.

runners.breeder: S A S U Ecurie Des Monceaux Et Al
runners.comment: Useful Flat racer; well beaten on three hurdle starts but has lowly opening handicap mark
runners.name: Victory Shout
runners.spotlight: Well beaten all three hurdling starts, the last twice for new stable towards end of last year, but this useful Flat racer has a lowly opening mark for his handicap hurdle debut and is open to improvement in this sphere.

runners.comment: Absent since pulled up twice in spring 2024 but still worth a glance in the betting
runners.name: Celine Man
runners.spotlight: Absent since pulled up on consecutive appearances for Henrietta Knight in April 2024 (3m1f/2m7f) and 8lb out of the weights for this stable debut but had a wind op in September and is worth a glance in the betting.

14:40.race_name: Play Golden Goals At BetMGM Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: 2-2 since switched to handicaps this season and might still be on the upgrade
runners.name: Got A Dream
runners.spotlight: 2-2 since switched to handicaps this season, the latter win gained at Warwick (2m5f, good) in November; might still be on the upgrade and needs to be taken very seriously.

runners.comment: Went close on handicap hurdle debut in April and ran well on Flat for new yard last month
runners.name: Cruden
runners.spotlight: Not seen over hurdles since going very close on handicap debut at Carlisle (3m1f, good) for James Ewart last April but made pleasing stable debut on the Flat last month (cheekpieces refitted) and features prominently in calculations here.

runners.comment: Ended last season with a good run but was back in the doldrums on reappearance outing
runners.name: Geezer Rockstar
runners.spotlight: Returned to form with close second at Chepstow (2m3f, good; after wind op) at end of last season but was back in the doldrums on reappearance outing in November; now sports cheekpieces; others look much less risky.

runners.comment: Came good in Plumpton maiden in November, form that has worked out well; handicap debut
runners.name: Maldini Milano
runners.spotlight: Delivered on early promise when winning Plumpton maiden (2m4f, good; first-time cheekpieces) in November, form that has been well advertised by the second and third since; should have more improvement to come in handicaps; shortlisted.

runners.comment: Signalled possible return to form when making a lot of the running at Cheltenham last time
runners.name: Moutarde
runners.spotlight: Well beaten on first two starts for Syd Hosie but put in fairly good front-running shift before weakening into eighth at Cheltenham (2m1f, good to soft; first-time visor) last month; contests this easier race from a workable mark and has possibilities if the new trip suits.

runners.comment: Ought to be suited by this return to good ground and may still have potential
runners.name: The Expensive One
runners.spotlight: Made all on handicap debut at Stratford (2m2f, good) in October and was running well until jumping error caused rider to lose iron at Cheltenham later that month; safely held on soft ground in November but back on a sounder surface here and may still have potential.

runners.comment: Low-mileage 6yo; drops in grade after good handicap third at Taunton (2m3f) last month
runners.name: Call Me Legend
runners.spotlight: Kept on for third in Taunton handicap (2m3f, good) last month and has now made the frame on all four hurdling starts; moves up in trip and down in grade here; must be considered.

runners.comment: Unexposed after only five hurdle starts but was well beaten on seasonal reappearance
runners.name: George Henry
runners.spotlight: Unexposed after only five hurdle runs but managed only third of four over C&D (good) on handicap debut last March and was well beaten (albeit on soft ground) when returning last month; stable has much more obvious chance with Maldini Milano.

15:17.race_name: Daily Profit Boosts At BetMGM Novices' Handicap Chase

runners.comment: Ended last year in good form over hurdles and fences here (2m4f); hiked up in trip today
runners.name: Staff Sergeant Len
runners.spotlight: 0-12 under all codes but gave good account when third in 14-runner handicap hurdle here (2m4f, good; cheekpieces refitted) in November and held every chance before last-fence unseat on recent chasing debut here (2m4f, good to soft); not bred for this much longer trip but is a major player if his stamina holds out; swaps usual cheekpieces for first-time visor.

runners.breeder: S C E A De La Metairie
runners.comment: Left poor chasing debut behind when winning at Leicester last month; can improve again
runners.name: Amazing Cleni
runners.owner: May We Never Be Found Out Partnership 2
runners.spotlight: Low-mileage 6yo who left his very disappointing chase debut a long way behind when keeping on well to score at Leicester (2m6f, good) last month; moves up in trip again here and has plenty of scope for further progress.

runners.comment: Pulled up on both starts since long absence (hurdle/chase); needs to turn a corner
runners.name: Defi Nonantais
runners.spotlight: Returned from long layoff with disappointing hurdle run in November and was pulled up again (albeit on heavy ground) when fitted with blinkers for last month's chasing debut; may yet get career back on track but it takes a leap of faith to support him here; cheekpieces refitted.

runners.comment: Third three times over 2m4f in autumn but not bred to benefit from this hike up in trip
runners.name: Sweet Nightingale
runners.spotlight: Third three consecutive times over 2m4f on good ground (once here) in the autumn and may not have handled good to soft when pulled up last month but still has something to prove after that latest run and is not bred to benefit from this hike up in trip.

runners.comment: Well beaten in first two chases but last month's C&D third was much better
runners.name: Tuscan Rose
runners.spotlight: Dual hurdle winner; lacked fluency and was well beaten in first two chases but fared much better when third in refitted cheekpieces over C&D (soft) last month; contender if in similar form on the faster ground today.

15:50.race_name: Download The BetMGM App Maiden Hurdle (GBB Race)

runners.comment: 2nd in two Irish points but didn't show much at 200-1 in a 2m maiden hurdle at Newbury
runners.name: Aberfeldy
runners.spotlight: Failed to complete in three of his Irish maiden points; runner-up in the other two but didn't show much when 200-1 in a maiden hurdle at Newbury (2m, good to soft) on rules debut in November; upped in trip and dropped in class.

runners.breeder: Dr V Roger-Yves Simon & Nicolas Simon &
runners.comment: Not far away in two bumpers, latterly at 10-11; considered on hurdle debut; yard runs two
runners.name: A King Of Magic
runners.spotlight: Not far away in bumpers at Kempton (good to soft) in February and Ffos Las (soft) in October; the latter defeat came at 10-11 but he again showed enough ability to be considered on today's hurdle debut; yard runs two.

runners.comment: Modest form at best in three bumpers and twice when 200-1 over about 2m4f as a hurdler
runners.name: Badentaggart
runners.spotlight: Modest form at best in three bumpers and twice when 200-1 over about 2m4f as a hurdler; blinkered last time and today; needs a transformation.

runners.comment: Placed in two points; heavy defeats over hurdles at Taunton (2m) and Ascot (2m5f)
runners.name: Charlies Jetaway
runners.spotlight: Placed in two points in May but has suffered heavy defeats over hurdles when 50-1 at Taunton (2m, good) and 250-1 at Ascot (2m5f, soft).

runners.comment: Sixth of nine in a Fontwell bumper but did not show much in 2m4f maiden hurdle at Plumpton
runners.name: Crest Of Valour
runners.spotlight: While sixth of nine in a Fontwell bumper (2m1f, good to soft) in October contained some promise, he did not show much in maiden hurdle at Plumpton (2m4f, soft; 14-1) in early December.

runners.comment: Short-head winner of a four-runner Irish point in November; perhaps a longer-term prospect
runners.name: Fane Court
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam unraced half-sister to fairly useful winners Kemal's Council (3m/3m1f hurdle/chase) and Oberon Moon (bumper/3m hurdle), out of unraced half-sister to useful staying hurdler/chaser Fane Banks; short-head winner of a four-runner Irish maiden point in November but perhaps a longer-term prospect under rules.

runners.comment: Ran in two Irish maiden points, winning by 6l on second occasion (soft); wind op since
runners.name: Hydration Station
runners.spotlight: 13,000euros foal, 12,000euros 3yo; eighth foal; half-brother to four jump winners, two of them fair performers under rules; dam unraced sister to bumper and 2m3f/2m4f hurdle winner City Theatre; ran in two Irish maiden points, winning by 6l on second occasion (soft) and the form has been boosted; had wind surgery in August; one to note for yard which runs two.

runners.comment: Fairly useful in bumpers and his latest start was the best hurdles form in this field
runners.name: Kilwaughter
runners.spotlight: Fairly useful form in bumpers, including two at major festivals in the spring; folded tamely in Grade 2 on hurdling debut at Chepstow (2m3f) but fourth of 16 at Exeter (2m, good to soft) was better, even though a 20l defeat; he may well need to build on it but that's the best hurdles form in this field.

runners.comment: 18-1, faded to go down by 37l in maiden hurdle at Leicester (2m4f, soft) one month ago
runners.name: Pops Folly
runners.spotlight: Better effort in bumpers on second start; 18-1, faded to go down by 37l in maiden hurdle at Leicester (2m4f, soft) one month ago, so looks a longer-term prospect.

runners.comment: 3rd in bumper at Chepstow (good to soft); disappointing favourite at Exeter (soft) latest
runners.name: Sailing By
runners.owner: J M Dare, T Hamlin, J W Snook
runners.spotlight: Interesting on pedigree and on his staying-on third of 13 in a bumper at Chepstow (2m, good to soft) in November; disappointing favourite at Exeter (soft) four weeks ago but needs a second look on this hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Second and a 13l winner in Irish maiden points in May, shortly before 62,000euros sale
runners.name: Seaniecon
runners.spotlight: 10,500euros foal, 12,000euros 3yo; third foal; dam bumper/2m hurdle winner, half-sister to winners including Tanit River (useful 2m-3m hurdle/chase); second and a 13l winner in Irish maiden points in May, shortly before 62,000euros sale; market can guide on hurdles debut and he needs a check.

runners.comment: Made a splash on range of ground in bumpers; a well-related hurdle newcomer, one to note
runners.name: Sinchi Roca
runners.spotlight: Won his only start in points and has also made a splash on range of ground in bumpers, including with a rallying second in Cheltenham Listed race in November on third occasion; failed to match that at Ascot 15 days ago but this well-related hurdle newcomer is one to note.

11:40.race_name: Read Meg Nicholls' Blog At betmgm.co.uk Fillies' Handicap

runners.comment: Got up late to beat Cooramook over C&D in August; encouraging run here latest
runners.name: So Sassy
runners.spotlight: Dynamic finish when getting up on the line to head Cooramook over C&D in August; can go on from that and her recent run back here, when a keeping-on fourth to a well-treated winner (and just behind a subsequent winner), was encouraging; dropped 2lb; can be involved.

runners.comment: Acts over C&D but seemingly best at Chelmsford; still 3lb above highest winning mark
runners.name: Bint Havana Gold
runners.owner: Alan & Christine Bright And John Henwood
runners.spotlight: Acts over C&D but five AW wins have come elsewhere and seemingly best at Chelmsford; her latest win there (6f) in October was by a wide margin and inevitably it's been more difficult for her since; has a shade to prove until back on or below that winning mark.

runners.comment: At home on Polytrack; won at Wolverhampton (6f) in November; needs more than latest 3rd
runners.name: Addarella
runners.spotlight: Perfectly at home on Polytrack when runner-up in an ordinary 7f race here in October; consistent since and ultimately a ready winner at Wolverhampton (6f) in November before finishing close up, not finding a great deal, there 14 days ago; needs more left on the same mark.

runners.comment: Turf winner at 5f; not sustain effort in previous 6f run and has been off since August
runners.name: Hello Luna
runners.spotlight: Off the mark in her third handicap, over 5f at Windsor, but couldn't sustain effort when tackling 6f there in July and has been off since finishing lame in August (following a pre-race incident).

runners.comment: First 6f run since touched off by So Sassy over C&D in August; less favourable terms today
runners.name: Cooramook
runners.spotlight: Maiden after 13 starts but somewhat luckless to lose out on the line to So Sassy over C&D (made the running) in August; less favourable terms today but in form and this is her first 6f run since; bold bid possible.

runners.comment: Won three 6f turf handicaps in 2024; terribly vulnerable since; had wind op since latest
runners.name: Griselda
runners.spotlight: Won three 6f turf handicaps in a row during 2024 but she's been terribly vulnerable since, especially in the autumn; a ray of hope in that wind surgery may have made a difference.

runners.comment: Broke AW duck over C&D; not so good next time but might yet improve a little back at 6f
runners.name: Lahina Bay
runners.spotlight: Broke AW duck over C&D in November but she was just a one-paced fifth of ten under a penalty here last month; can be excused a 5f defeat on this sharp course since and she might yet improve a little back over 6f.

runners.comment: 2-2 in 6f Polytrack handicaps, winning with authority over C&D latest; up 6lb; respected
runners.name: All Too Beautiful
runners.spotlight: Has improved since running in 6f Polytrack handicaps and was a resolute winner at Chelmsford before taking a C&D race with authority 19 days ago; up 6lb in a better race but can continue the good work.

runners.comment: Bumpy career but impressed at Kempton (6f) on yard debut; respected with Oisin Murphy up
runners.name: Calafrio
runners.spotlight: Her road has been bumpy but she impressed when winning at Kempton (6f; tongue-tie added to cheekpieces) in November on yard debut and the race didn't unfold so well at Chelmsford since; good chance of a big run with Oisin Murphy back in the saddle.

runners.comment: No real impact in three 7f runs but finished strongly for handicap debut win at 1m; up 6lb
runners.name: Florida Suite
runners.spotlight: No serious impact in three 7f events and was easy to back for her handicap debut at Southwell (1m; first-time blinkers, retained) but the extra furlong was a clear advantage as she powered home for a ready win; has been raised 6lb but there should be more to come.

runners.comment: All races at about 1m; travelled strongly before winning on AW debut; up 4lb; promising
runners.name: Charlotte Corday
runners.spotlight: All races at about 1m, keeping on willingly to take a late third of five on her handicap debut at Redcar, but travelling with more purpose before making a successful AW debut at Wolverhampton in November; up 4lb on Polytrack debut; looks promising.

runners.comment: 66-1 and bigger in all 3 starts; some promise on 2nd start; may do better now handicapping
runners.name: Upsomdowns
runners.spotlight: 66-1 and bigger in three starts, doing best when hanging on well to a prominent position when fourth at Kempton (7f) in October; highly tried there (1m) after but this is his first realistic chance now handicapping.

runners.comment: Made running and foiled only late at Wolverhampton on Tuesday; should give it a good shot
runners.name: Credit Forgedd It
runners.spotlight: Was running in his third handicap, off 6lb lower than the first, when only just foiled after making the running at Wolverhampton (upped to about 1m) on Tuesday; tackles improvers but can give it a good shot.

runners.comment: Beaten 11l+ in three runs at 1m and 7f; should have more going for him now handicapping
runners.name: John Harrison
runners.spotlight: Beaten 11l+ in three runs at 1m and 7f; hard to know what he achieved when runner-up to a Godolphin newcomer who was a class apart at Southwell last month but this first go in a handicap will reveal more.

runners.comment: Kept on well over 7f here but didn't see out the stiff 1m at Newcastle; now handicapping
runners.name: Fille Imbassee
runners.spotlight: Achieved little on first two starts but she kept up the chase to finish on the heels of the first two over 7f here before being outstayed over 1m at Newcastle last month; should see out 1m on this less testing track and do better at this level.

12:40.race_name: Best Odds Guaranteed At BetMGM Restricted Maiden Stakes (For Horses In Bands C And D) (GBB Race)

runners.comment: Stable not known for winning newcomers; one for middle-distance handicaps in due course
runners.name: Goldfinder
runners.spotlight: First foal; dam unraced half-sister to winners Certificate (smart 7f/1m), Marma's Boy (9.4f/1m2f), Progressive (1m2f/1m4f Flat and 2m hurdle) and Temple Lock (1m4f/1m6f); stable not known for winning newcomers; looks one for middle-distance handicaps in due course.

runners.breeder: Cornthrop Bloodstock, Widden Stud Uk Pty
runners.comment: Interesting on breeding, but would be a rare winning newcomer from the yard
runners.name: Tonyfromhr
runners.spotlight: 35,000gns yearling; brother to 6f AW winner I Maximus (RPR 81), half-brother to winners, all including 2yo/AW, Rose Premium (6f/6.5f including Listed; 103), Louliana (6f/6.5f including Listed; 102) and Premiere Beauty (6f; 86); dam Listed-placed winner (including 2yo; 94); interesting on breeding, but would be a rare winning newcomer from the yard.

runners.comment: Fifth in all three starts on turf last year; should stay 1m; contender if ready to go
runners.name: Foothold
runners.spotlight: Fifth in all three starts at around 6f on turf last year, beaten just over a length at Bath (soft) on the final occasion; dam won over 1m4f so the longer trip should be within range; contender if ready to go after four months off.

runners.comment: Steadily progressive in four starts last year; 1m should suit and he sets the standard
runners.name: Maskatto
runners.spotlight: Steadily progressive in four starts over 7f last year, finishing second of 11 at Southwell (Tapeta) in October; this extra furlong should suit on breeding and he sets the standard; stable won a division of this last year.

runners.comment: Beaten a long way into last of 12 on his debut over C&D 12 days ago; no appeal
runners.name: Serragasso
runners.spotlight: 250-1 when beaten a long way into last of 12 on his debut over C&D 12 days ago; no appeal.

runners.comment: May need further in time, but stable had a 16-1 winning newcomer on Tuesday
runners.name: Si White
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Xxx & Chris Rees
runners.spotlight: 11,000euros yearling; closely related to German 1m4f/14.7f winner Sagrado; dam Listed-placed 7f winner, half-sister to Listed-placed 8.5f-10.5f winner Simon Magus, out of German 1,000 Guineas second; may need further in time, but stable had a 16-1 winning newcomer at Wolverhampton on Tuesday.

runners.comment: Caught the eye when seventh on last month's debut over C&D; worth keeping an eye on
runners.name: Terranoble
runners.spotlight: Sent off 33-1 when seventh of 11 on his debut over C&D last month, but did make some eyecatching late progress; worth keeping an eye on.

runners.comment: Stable not known for winning newcomers
runners.name: Dors Dazzler
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to 1m2f AW winner Dors Delight (RPR 55); dam 1m AW/1m2f turf winner (65), half-sister to French 10.5f/1m4f winner Law Of Logic, out of French 11.5f and 1m4f (Listed) winner; withdrawn after getting upset in the stalls on her intended debut at Kempton in August; stable not known for winning newcomers.

runners.breeder: Sheikh Khalid Bin Ali Al Khalifa
runners.comment: Stable can get them ready first time and worth a market check
runners.name: Goldust Woman
runners.spotlight: 34,000euros foal, 40,000euros yearling; half-sister to 1m AW winner Suspicion (RPR 85); dam unraced half-sister to winners Ninjago (6f Listed) and Florestans Match (6f), out of French 7.5f Listed winner; stable can get them ready first time and worth a market check.

runners.comment: Stable does have winning newcomers, but her pedigree suggests she will need further
runners.name: Pangbourne
runners.spotlight: Dam maiden (stayed 1m4f; RPR 77) half-sister to winners Ocean Wind (Group-placed 11.6f-2m2f), Three Kingdoms (smart 2m-3m hurdle/chase) and Ivoire (Brazilian 1m4f Group 1), out of Brazilian 1m2f Group 1 winner; stable does have winners first time out, but her pedigree suggests she will come into her own over further.

13:10.race_name: Always Gamble Responsibly At BetMGM Handicap

runners.comment: 7f maiden winner here and not beaten far over C&D last month; each-way claims
runners.name: Virtue Patience
runners.spotlight: Won a 7f maiden here last March; a bit in and out since, but he wasn't beaten far into fifth of ten on his return from 102 days off over C&D (first start since wind surgery) last month; each-way claims.

runners.comment: 7f has looked a struggle so not hard to have reservations over this trip
runners.name: My Awele
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing Cii And Partners
runners.spotlight: Dual Southwell Tapeta winner (5f/6f) in 2024 and scored at Leicester (6f, good to firm) last summer; 7f has looked to be a struggle, though, so not hard to have reservations over this trip.

runners.comment: Five of his six wins have come at around this trip; may have needed last month's return
runners.name: Union Island
runners.spotlight: Five of his six wins have come at around this trip, two on the AW at the end of 2024 and a hat-trick on turf in the middle of last year; may have needed last month's return from 145 days off and not easily dismissed.

runners.comment: Went down by only a neck at Wolverhampton three weeks ago; one of the likelier winners
runners.name: Pitney
runners.spotlight: Has dropped a long way in the weights since returning for this yard last May and went down by only a neck at Wolverhampton (8.6f, Tapeta) three weeks ago; back up 1lb but still one of the likelier winners.

runners.comment: Beaten less than a length into third over C&D on Wednesday; major player with a repeat
runners.name: Way To Dubai
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner over 1m in Germany who is 0-28 since arriving in Britain, but he was beaten less than a length into third of six over C&D on Wednesday; major player with a repeat.

runners.comment: Veteran whose losing run is up to 13 despite a sliding mark; others appeal more
runners.name: Repertoire
runners.spotlight: Veteran whose losing run is up to 13 despite a sliding mark and he ended up well held on his return from eight months off at Newmarket (1m, good) in October (has twice won fresh); others appeal more.

runners.comment: 0-10 in turf in Ireland and well held in two starts here for this yard; look elsewhere
runners.name: Manhattan Chute
runners.owner: J May, R L Field, W Trenchard, J Pook
runners.spotlight: 0-10 in turf in Ireland and well held in two starts here (6f/7f) for this yard; look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Promising early on as a 2yo, but has gone the wrong way since and now 0-9; blinkers on
runners.name: Fool Again
runners.spotlight: Promising early on as a 2yo, but has gone the wrong way since and now 0-9; 1m2f looked too far on stable debut here 12 days ago, but she still needs the switch from cheekpieces to blinkers to have a positive effect.

13:45.race_name: Midnite A Next Generation Betting App Handicap

runners.comment: Three wins on Tapeta including last time, but handles Polytrack; respected despite penalty
runners.name: Mr Nugget
runners.spotlight: All three wins have come on Tapeta including at Southwell (1m3f) six days ago, but has made the frame in all three starts on Polytrack including over C&D; much respected despite penalty.

runners.comment: Only had three starts despite being an 8yo; worth a market check on handicap debut
runners.name: Marine
runners.spotlight: Out of a half-sister to King George/Arc winner Danedream; only had three starts despite being an 8yo and was well held when fourth of seven here (1m2f) last month; worth a market check up in trip on handicap debut.

runners.comment: Has become disappointing and now 0-14; makes little appeal
runners.name: Boston Run
runners.spotlight: Showed ability for Hugo Palmer, but has become disappointing and has been well beaten in three starts on Polytrack since joining this yard, taking his record to 0-14; makes little appeal; stable also runs Jack Langley.

runners.comment: Record here reads 512131; up 4lb but still high on the list given his liking for the venue
runners.name: Jack Langley
runners.spotlight: Record here reads 512131 including two wins over this trip, while last month's success came over 1m5f; up 4lb but still high on the list given his liking for this venue.

runners.comment: 0-7; each-way claims on best form, but dropping to 1m4f on a sharp track may not be ideal
runners.name: Mio Amico
runners.spotlight: 0-7 and a bit of a mixed bag since switched to the AW in October; each-way claims on his best form, but dropping to 1m4f on a sharp track may not be ideal.

runners.comment: Nothing in four starts for this yard and now 0-9; look elsewhere
runners.name: Luisa
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden; twice placed at Wolverhampton (8.6f/9.5f) for James Fanshawe but nothing in four starts for this yard; look elsewhere.

runners.comment: Losing run up to 18 and still to prove she wants this far
runners.name: Kaaress
runners.spotlight: Four wins for Ollie Pears including Wolverhampton hat-trick (8.6f/9.5f) in the autumn of 2023, but losing run up to 18; blew the start on stable debut here (1m2f) last month and still to prove she wants this far.

runners.comment: Little in four starts over hurdles and one on Polytrack for this yard; cheekpieces on
runners.name: Banksman
runners.spotlight: Dual turf winner at around 1m for Jack Channon last summer, but four starts over hurdles and one here (1m2f) 12 days ago since joining this yard leave him with plenty to prove, not least stamina; cheekpieces given a go.

runners.comment: Both wins over 1m2f here but has run well over C&D; holds stronger claims than many
runners.name: Dubai Harbour
runners.spotlight: Dual course winner over 1m2f last winter and ran well to finish third of 16 behind Jack Langley over C&D in October; back up in trip after good 1m2f second last month; holds stronger claims than many.

runners.comment: Out of the frame in five starts on the AW so enough to prove back from 75 days off
runners.name: Bramble Jelly
runners.spotlight: 2-27 with the wins coming on turf (1m2f, heavy) and over hurdles in the autumn of 2024; out of the frame in five starts on the AW, so enough to prove back from 75 days off.

runners.comment: Off since pulling up at Windsor in June; cheekpieces replace visor; watch market
runners.name: Spaceage Love Song
runners.owner: M L W Bell Racing Ltd
runners.spotlight: Beaten less than a length into fourth of nine at Kempton (1m4f, Polytrack) a year ago, but pulled up early on his return at Windsor in June and has been off again since; interesting to see what the market says with cheekpieces replacing a visor.

14:20.race_name: Midnite Are Upping The Betting Game Handicap (GBBPlus Race)

runners.comment: Chased home an improver at Newcastle last month; return to this trip should suit
runners.name: Pride Of Donegal
runners.spotlight: Made a successful handicap debut at Kempton (1m4f, Polytrack) in October and, after flopping there next time, bounced back when chasing home an improver at Newcastle (1m2f, Tapeta) last month; return to this trip should suit and he's one for the shortlist.

runners.comment: Runner-up on stable debut over C&D last month; respected from the same mark
runners.name: Kimeko Glory
runners.spotlight: Three wins over 1m2f on turf last year and was making her stable debut when second of seven over C&D last month; respected from the same mark.

runners.comment: Has regressed since winning twice last spring and and not easy to recommend for now
runners.name: Educator
runners.spotlight: Won his first two starts after wind surgery last spring including over C&D, but has regressed since and is not easy to recommend despite having dropped 3lb below his last winning mark.

runners.comment: Has taken off since returning in November; should be hard to beat in his hat-trick bid
runners.name: Westcombe
runners.spotlight: Has taken off since returning from another absence in November, winning under positive rides at Kempton (1m4f, Polytrack) and Wolverhampton (1m4f, Tapeta) last month; up another 6lb, but very much on the up and should be hard to beat in his hat-trick bid.

runners.comment: Runner-up to Westcombe at Wolverhampton last time and 6lb better off; shortlisted
runners.name: Charlies Choice
runners.spotlight: Running well lately as when beaten just over 2l into second of ten behind Westcombe at Wolverhampton (1m4f, Tapeta) a fortnight ago; may have finished closer with a clearer run and 6lb better off here, but he is more much exposed than his old rival; shortlisted nonetheless.

runners.comment: Six wins here and back off last winning mark; recent efforts leave him with a bit to prove
runners.name: Raintown
runners.owner: Ms Caroline Instone & J S Moore
runners.spotlight: Six wins over 1m-1m4f around here and back off the same mark as when last successful, but recent efforts leave him with a bit to prove.

runners.comment: Nine-race maiden whose best efforts have come on Tapeta, needs a bit more
runners.name: Eupator
runners.owner: Middleham Park Racing I And Partner
runners.spotlight: Nine-race maiden whose best efforts have come on Tapeta, as when a front-running third of ten at Wolverhampton (1m4f) a fortnight ago (Westcombe won the other division in a much quicker time); needs a bit more.
