runners.comment: Lightly-raced, she did her best work when third of six here in October.
runners.name: Sovereign Applause
runners.spotlight: Lightly-raced, she did her best work when third of six here (1m4f) in October; last of five over hurdles since; has had wind surgery and sports a first-time tongue-tie and may have more to offer in this sphere.

runners.comment: 0-8 but has been placed on two of his last three starts for current stable.
runners.name: Edwardtheninth
runners.spotlight: 0-8 but has been placed on two of his last three starts for current stable; open to improvement and should run well.

runners.comment: Sole success came at Newcastle AW in September 2024; has not matched that form since.
runners.name: Different Drum
runners.spotlight: Sole success came at Newcastle AW in September 2024; has not matched that form following a short break in two starts in November and needs to show more.

runners.comment: 0-7 but has shown improved form since switching to current yard on last three starts.
runners.name: Arcimboldo
runners.spotlight: 0-7 but has shown improved form since switching to current yard on last three starts, latest when third of 13 at Newcastle (2m) in November; holds place claims at least.

20:30.race_name: Make The Move To Midnite Handicap

runners.comment: C&D winner; some promise when 3rd at Newcastle two starts ago but faded badly since
runners.name: Bearwith
runners.spotlight: Multiple winner, once over C&D; some signs he might be running into form again at Newcastle (1m2f; first-time blinkers) two starts ago but he didn't put up much of a show behind Golspie there last month and has a question mark against him with headgear left off.

runners.breeder: Lofts Hall Stud, B Sangster, New England
runners.comment: Two C&D wins and reliable here; back to winning form latest; still well treated; solid
runners.name: Tortured Soul
runners.spotlight: Reliable here, winning two over C&D and yet to be beaten more than 2l; has taken time to recapture form since back from a break but a strong late burst got him up on the line at Lingfield (1m2f) last month; still 4lb lower than when a good runner-up on latest course start last March; solid.

runners.breeder: S C E A Du Haras Des Sablonnets Et Al
runners.comment: Close up in two 1m4f Wolverhampton races; poor latest; now makes course debut
runners.name: Brodies Boy
runners.spotlight: Sole win in 1m4f Kempton maiden as 3yo; best efforts for this yard when close up at Wolverhampton (1m4f) twice in the autumn but he was way below best at Lingfield since; reservations after that on course debut.

runners.comment: Won at 1m2f (AW) and 1m4f (turf) in 2025 for previous yard; remote runs for new stable
runners.name: Shahbaz
runners.spotlight: Two wins in 2025 for previous yard, over 1m2f at Chelmsford and 1m4f at Newbury, but he's raced in the rear and stayed there in all four runs for this trainer; may well take advantage of this good mark at some stage.

runners.comment: Things haven't worked out in Tapeta handicaps so far but might do better over this trip
runners.name: Kings Hand
runners.spotlight: Promising handicap debut when strong-finishing close second at Wolverhampton (about 1m1f) but turned over at a short price there after and a Newcastle run in November was less good; the handicap debut run suggests 1m3f could suit, though, and can't give up on him on this course debut.

runners.comment: Won 2 out of 3 AW races early in 2025; modest hurdle form in June; off since; had wind op
runners.name: Return With Gold
runners.spotlight: Won two of three AW races in early 2025, most recently an amateur jockeys' race over C&D; had two abortive goes over hurdles in June and had wind surgery since; hard to weigh up after layoff.

runners.comment: Bled from the nose in December; sold £6,000 since; capable of going well if on song again
runners.name: Educate
runners.spotlight: Course winner at 1m and over 1m4f at Wolverhampton; involved in some tight finishes in the autumn for previous yard but bled from the nose in December and sold for £6,000 since; capable of going well if back to best.

runners.comment: Stays 1m3f on turf; usually races at 1m2f, won at Newcastle in December; hampered since
runners.name: Golspie
runners.spotlight: Stays 1m3f on turf but 1m2f at Newcastle is his regular stamping ground; took advantage of weights drop when winning there in December and not clear run on Monday; better claims than many if adapting to this track (well beaten over 1m on only previous attempt) but without regular cheekpieces.

runners.breeder: Exors Of The Late Mrs B E Moore
runners.comment: Two fair runs from last three starts, the latest when 3rd over C&D; thereabouts
runners.name: Arths Gold
runners.spotlight: Moderate two starts ago but he didn't have an easy passage when sixth at Wolverhampton (about 1m1f; King's Hand second) previously and he looked lonely in front before overhauled late over C&D (first-time cheekpieces, retained) since; thereabouts.

runners.comment: Hurdle winner; showed turf promise at 1m3f but miles behind Golspie on recent AW debut
runners.name: Blackwater Lilly
runners.spotlight: Hurdle winner; shaped quite well when fourth on handicap debut at Carlisle (1m3f) in August but she finished miles behind Golspie at Newcastle recently on AW debut; cheekpieces return but has much to prove.

12:35.race_name: Happy New Year From All At Cork Maiden Hurdle

runners.comment: Beaten 15l when second in a bumper, no sign that he can win a maiden hurdle at this stage
runners.name: Coolboy Christy
runners.spotlight: Beaten 15l when second in a bumper; no sign that he can win a maiden hurdle at this stage.

runners.comment: Dropped away to finish towards the back at Gowran first time out, unlikely to feature
runners.name: Don Jefe
runners.spotlight: Dropped away to finish towards the back at Gowran first time out, unlikely to feature.

runners.comment: Never better than sixth in seven outings on the Flat, not a likely contender here
runners.name: Khormor Syd
runners.spotlight: Never better than sixth in seven outings on the Flat, not a likely contender here.

runners.comment: Half-brother to three jumps winners, dam a well-related French chase winner
runners.name: Maxfort
runners.spotlight: Tenth foal; half-brother to winners Chatterbox (bumper/useful 2m hurdle), Minella Beau (useful 2m-2m6f hurdle/chase) and Miss Maxfort (2m hurdle); dam French 2m3f chase winner, half-sister to high-class chasers My Will and Unioniste.

runners.comment: Massive price when down the field over C&D on debut, similar scenario is probable
runners.name: One Of Mine
runners.spotlight: Massive price when down the field over C&D on debut, similar scenario is probable.

runners.comment: Placed twice on the Flat for Andrew Balding, has struggled in two maiden hurdle outings
runners.name: Parkland
runners.spotlight: Placed twice on the Flat for Andrew Balding; questions to answer on his 2025 Flat form; has struggled in two maiden hurdle outings.

runners.comment: Promise on AW and in a maiden hurdle at Navan, the future may lie in handicaps, hooded
runners.name: Silent Guardian
runners.spotlight: Fair 74-rated Flat maiden; stable debut on AW at Dundalk was encouraging; showed up well before fading into sixth in a 25-runner maiden hurdle at Navan four weeks ago; can probably pick up a race, but more likely a handicap in due course; hooded.

runners.breeder: S C E A Des Prairies, M Benoit Jeffroy & M Thomas Jeffroy
runners.comment: Point winner, probably not seen to best effect in a bumper, could make presence felt now
runners.name: Speculateur
runners.spotlight: Point winner for champion handler Colin Bowe; probably not seen to best effect in a bumper; could make his presence felt now, bearing in mind the stable's brilliant form.

runners.comment: Won his final two Flats start for William Haggas, useful recruit for the champion trainer
runners.name: The Reverend
runners.spotlight: 150,000gns yearling; brother to Italian Group 2 winner Angel Power; impressed on handicap debut at Ascot (1m4f, soft) in September 2024; failed to kick on from that initially but got back on track with a convincing win in a small field at Ripon (1m4f, soft) in July; backed that up with a hard-earned win in the 1m6f Old Borough Cup at Haydock; useful recruit to hurdling.

runners.comment: Raced a bit too keenly and was done with three out on debut at Limerick, can be ruled out
runners.name: Young Mans Game
runners.spotlight: Raced a bit too keenly and was done with three out on debut at Limerick; can be ruled out.

runners.comment: Moderate fifth at this venue on first attempt, pulled up over C&D last month, 66-1 then
runners.name: Clarin Breeze
runners.spotlight: Moderate fifth at this venue on first attempt; pulled up over C&D last month, 66-1 then.

runners.comment: Tenth foal; half-sister to bumper/Flat/hurdle winner Sneaky Getaway, dam Flat maiden
runners.name: Its All Yellow
runners.spotlight: Tenth foal; half-sister to bumper/Flat/hurdle winner Sneaky Getaway; dam Flat maiden, half-sister to French 3m1f Grade 2 chase winner Astonville.

runners.comment: Two fair bumper runs on home soil, questions to answer after failing to count at Catterick
runners.name: Let It Settle
runners.spotlight: Two fair bumper runs on home soil; questions to answer after failing to count at Catterick last month; tongue-tie discarded.

runners.comment: Down the field in maidens here and Clonmel, perhaps one for handicaps with more experience
runners.name: Rubi Tuesday
runners.spotlight: Down the field in maidens here and Clonmel; perhaps one for handicaps with more experience.

runners.comment: Dam unraced half-sister to Flat/hurdle winner Lady In Lavender, not much appeal on paper
runners.name: Success Mode
runners.spotlight: Dam unraced half-sister to Flat/2m hurdle winner Lady In Lavender and to a point/chase winner Lady Kate; not of any great appeal on paper.

runners.comment: Three-time winner on the Flat at Galway, no success elsewhere, hooded for hurdling debut
runners.name: Sylkie
runners.spotlight: Three-time winner on the Flat at Galway; no success elsewhere; ran another sound race at her favourite track when fourth of 16 in a handicap over the extended 1m in October; previous 1m2f Curragh third of 22 was a good effort too; hooded for hurdling debut.

runners.comment: Gave a solid display when third at Limerick last week, might prefer further than this
runners.name: Dawn Coming
runners.owner: Ms P Twiss & J Twiss & M Osullivan & S Nevin Twiss
runners.spotlight: Ran four times on the Flat for his breeder Jim Bolger, placed in a Curragh maiden and rated 73; bright start over hurdles over C&D when seemingly unfancied at Cork, beaten 2l in third; another solid display when third at Limerick last week, although he looked short of pace and might prefer further than this.

runners.comment: 80-rated Flat maiden, well held by Dawn Coming on running over C&D last month
runners.name: Mcloughlin
runners.spotlight: 80-rated Flat maiden; yet to show an equivalent standard over hurdles; well held by Dawn Coming on running over C&D last month.

runners.comment: Won at a modest level on AW in Britain, well held by Dawn Coming on running over C&D
runners.name: Ray Gun
runners.spotlight: Won at a modest level on AW in Britain; well held by Dawn Coming on running over C&D on Irish and hurdles debut.

runners.comment: 2m2f maiden hurdle winner (good) rated 119, below best after break latest, ground a query
runners.name: Kamino Bello
runners.spotlight: 2m2f (good) Sligo maiden hurdle winner is rated 119; below best on return from a 200-day break at Fairyhouse on latest in November; may improve for that but might prefer quicker ground than this.

runners.comment: 6.5l behind Spinola Bay latest, better off at weights now, could get closer to that rival
runners.name: Tatateo
runners.spotlight: Dual-purpose; 1-9 over hurdles and rated 115; had been in decent form on the Flat before an okay effort when beaten 6.5l behind Spinola Bay on return to hurdling at Leopardstown eight days ago; better off at weights now and could close the gap.

runners.comment: Back-to-back h'cap wins since return from layoff, big chance if this doesn't come too soon
runners.name: Spinola Bay
runners.spotlight: Upwardly mobile hurdler has returned from a long layoff with back-to-back 2m handicap wins at Navan (sft-hvy) and Leopardstown (yielding); now rated 113 and there could still be more to come from this 6yo; big chance if this doesn't come too soon.

runners.comment: 23l runner up in Thurles maiden hurdle latest, more needed to be competitive here
runners.name: Glenrush Bay
runners.spotlight: First sign of ability when a 23l second of 17 in a Thurles maiden hurdle in November; official rating of 110 may flatter him, however, and he needs more to be competitive in this company.

runners.comment: Modest point form in 2023, soundly beaten in bumper and maiden hurdle, hard to fancy
runners.name: Under Cover
runners.spotlight: Modest form in point-to-points in 2023; soundly beaten in a Fairyhouse bumper in October and Navan maiden hurdle in December; hard to fancy on the evidence of those two efforts.

runners.comment: Downpatrick maiden winner in May, rated 108, worth market check on seasonal return
runners.name: Youlita
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner; off the mark at the third attempt in maiden hurdles when last seen at Downpatrick in May (2m3f, good), earning a rating of 108; worth a market check on seasonal reappearance for shrewd yard.

runners.comment: Much improved effort when a 4l second at Tramore in November, go well with a repeat
runners.name: Youneedabitofluck
runners.spotlight: Left previous modest efforts behind when a keeping on 4l second of 14 behind a Willie Mullins-trained favourite at Tramore (2m, soft) in November; handed a rating of 107 after that and could go well if backing up that promising effort.

runners.comment: Narrowly denied in Punchestown handicap on heavy latest, better ground a query here
runners.name: Zuzukel
runners.spotlight: Maiden was narrowly denied off 103 in a handicap hurdle at Punchestown (2m, heavy) in November; best form is in testing conditions, so needs to prove his effectiveness on this better ground.

13:40.race_name: ITM Irish Stallion Trail 16th - 17th January Maiden Hurdle

runners.comment: 0-14, well beaten in a Limerick novice hurdle five days ago, other are more appealing
runners.name: Ask The Bookie
runners.spotlight: Remains a maiden after 14 runs over timber; well beaten in a 2m3f novice at Limerick five days ago; rated 100 and others have more appealing profiles.

runners.comment: Bumper winner, runner-up in both previous maiden hurdles, big chance upped in trip
runners.name: Fillyoureye
runners.owner: Mrs N Flynn & John Joseph Flynn
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner is from a good family and has finished runner-up in maiden hurdles at Navan (2m4f, sft-hvy) and Punchestown (2m3f, heavy); this better ground and step up in trip should suit; leading claims.

runners.comment: Point winner, 6l behind Fillyoureye when third on latest, place shout again upped in trip
runners.name: Frankies Freebie
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner on good ground for Colin Motherway; outran odds of 66-1 when an 11.5l third on heavy in a 2m3f maiden hurdle at Punchestown (6l behind Fillyoureye); place claims again upped in trip.

runners.comment: Remote second at Down Royal, beaten 25l at Fairyhouse latest, more needed
runners.name: Juke Hill
runners.spotlight: Placed in one of three starts in point-to-points; remote second on Rules' debut in a Down Royal maiden hurdle (2m6f, gd-yld); 16-1 and beaten 25l upped to 3m at Fairyhouse on latest; yard flying and the choice of Kennedy but she needs more.

runners.breeder: J Lebrun & A P Y Lebrun
runners.comment: Third in both starts last April-May beaten 10.5l and 18.5l, Kennedy prefers stablemate
runners.name: Kasanovas Dream
runners.spotlight: Third in both starts last April-May, over 16.5f at Tramore (beaten 10.5l) and over 2m3f at Kilbeggan (beaten 18.5l); lacks a recent run and Jack Kennedy prefers Juke Hill.

runners.comment: Promise in bumpers for Declan Queally, poor effort latest, new yard, check the market
runners.name: Kashchei
runners.spotlight: Shaped like this trip might suit in a couple of bumpers for Declan Queally (including here over 2m3f); well beaten joint favourite on final start for that stable in a Kilbeggan bumper in August (2m, gd-yld); worth a market check on first start for Cian Collins.

runners.comment: Promise in a Listowel bumper and Thurles maiden hurdle, should be in the shake up again
runners.name: Rebel Budz
runners.spotlight: Locally trained; 1-6 in point-to-points; promise on Rules' bow in a 2m4f Listowel bumper; 1.5l runner up on hurdling debut at Thurles in October (22.5f, gd-yld) and the winner has since won a handicap off 106; should be in the mix again.

runners.comment: Point winner, shaped like this trip might suit on hurdles debut at Punchestown, respected
runners.name: Shabby Hill
runners.spotlight: Soft ground point-to-point winner in March 2024 and subsequently bought for E50,000; kept on nicely enough for a 28l fifth of 18 on hurdling debut at Punchestown last month (2m3f, heavy); should appreciate this longer trip and respected for last year's winning stable.

runners.comment: Point and bumper winner, rated 117, well beaten at Thurles on Thursday, must bounce back
runners.name: St Lawrences Well
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point and bumper winner; remote second behind stablemate over C&D in October; soundly beaten at Tramore on New Year's Day; rated 117 but needs to bounce back from that.

runners.comment: Back from long layoff with 31l defeat at Limerick a week ago, much more needed
runners.name: Dixies Girl
runners.spotlight: Point-to-point winner; best run over timber an 8.75l fifth of 12 at Listowel in September 2023; beaten 31l on sole start since at Limerick a week ago; might need another run or two to hit top form.

14:15.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares Handicap Hurdle

runners.comment: Won this last year off 6lb lower, lacks a recent run but likes it here, go well if fit
runners.name: Cast A Spell
runners.spotlight: Maiden hurdle winner won this last year (yld-sft) off 6lb lower before coming up short off her revised mark in a hot handicap at Leopardstown (2m2f, soft); likes this track and could go well if fit for her seasonal return.

runners.comment: Won at Limerick 8 days, ago, rider's claim negates most of 8lb hike, leading claims
runners.name: Cousin Kate
runners.spotlight: Tramore maiden hurdle winner (2m, yielding); off the mark in handicaps when the 9-4 favourite at Limerick (2m4f, heavy) eight days ago, pulling clear after the last for a 4.5l win; talented rider's claim negates most of 8lb rise and she holds leading claims again.

runners.comment: 3-16 over hurdles, unsuccessful spell chasing, 7lb above last win, others preferred
runners.name: Jumping Susie
runners.spotlight: 3-16 over hurdles, the wins coming at 2m3f-2m5f; returns to hurdles after an unsuccessful chase campaign; remains 7lb above her last handicap win; others make more appeal.

runners.comment: Tipperary maiden winner, outclassed latest, up in trip for h'cap bow, can't discount
runners.name: Getaway Beo
runners.spotlight: Tipperary maiden hurdle (16.5f, gd-yld) winner in October was outclassed in a 2m1f Down Royal Grade 3 on her second start later that month; now steps up in trip for her handicap debut with her yard in sensational form so can't be discounted.

runners.comment: Fell on seasonal return, has slipped to dangerous mark but others arrive in better form
runners.name: Kimy
runners.spotlight: Has generally struggled since finishing second in a valuable mares' handicap at the DRF last year (Cast A Spell behind); 50-1 and fell early on her seasonal return last week at Leopardstown; on a dangerous mark so can't be dismissed, but others arrive in better form.

runners.comment: Progressed well last season, soft not ideal on seasonal return, best form on good ground
runners.name: Missus Beeton
runners.spotlight: In good form last year for Shane Nolan, winning off 98 at Limerick and running well in defeat off revised mark subsequently; best on good ground, so had an excuse for poor run on stable bow and seasonal return at Tramore; ground a concern again here.

runners.comment: 0-9 over timers, 17.5l behind Cousin Kate last time, work to do to turn that form around
runners.name: Catchabird
runners.spotlight: 0-9 over hurdles and was 17.5l behind Cousin Kate at Limerick last time out; much better off at the weights now but she has work to do to turn that form around; has a place chance all the same.

runners.comment: Won 0-100 at Galway on penultimate, beaten off revised mark latest, cheekpieces on
runners.name: Grace Faraday
runners.spotlight: Gained second win over hurdles in a 0-100 at Galway (3m, yielding) on her penultimate start in October; well beaten off revised mark at Limerick the following month; more needed up in class in first-time cheekpieces.

14:47.race_name: William Hill Each Way Extra Challenge Series Beginners Chase

runners.comment: 2-14 over hurdles, has run seven times over fences and has a modest official rating of 88
runners.name: Donnrua Dream
runners.spotlight: 2-14 over hurdles; last success was in March 2022; no signs of ending the drought in three hurdle runs this season, the most recent at Limerick five days ago; has run seven times over fences and has a modest official rating of 88.

runners.comment: Fair third of eight behind Aclass and today's rival Mount Shenshan at Tramore, can improve
runners.name: Lecales Diamond
runners.spotlight: Placed in a point-to-point on soft; 0-4 over hurdles and rated 86; took a step in the right direction when third of eight behind Aclass and today's rival Mount Shenshan on his chase debut at Tramore in November; Aclass has shown the form in a good light.

runners.comment: Placed in three of his last four races over hurdles, not one of his better runs on latest
runners.name: Live To Laugh
runners.owner: J Whittle/M Mcevoy/Good For A Laugh Synd/A Callan
runners.spotlight: Placed in three of his last four races over hurdles, no sign of progress since his second at Roscommon in September, however, that form has been given several endorsements by the winner Hitthehayson

runners.comment: Point winner on good ground last May, limited encouragement from his maiden hurdle form
runners.name: Mistyburn
runners.spotlight: Won a maiden point on good ground at Necarne in May; not disgraced in two bumper runs; tailed off at Limerick on hurdles debut; attracted the attention of the stewards with a mid-field run over 2m at Naas; rider reported interference and suggested likely need for a longer trip; plenty to prove now judged on runs at Limerick, Clonmel and Thurles.

runners.comment: Went very close in a handicap hurdle here early last month, disappointing run last Monday
runners.name: Rowdy
runners.spotlight: Career-best when narrowly beaten in a 24-runner handicap hurdle at this venue (2m4f, soft to heavy) early last month; raised 4lb to a mark of 99; faded tamely from two out when well fancied for a 2m4f handicap at Limerick last Monday.

runners.comment: Third in a Tramore handicap in November, will not need to improve much to be involved here
runners.name: Snow Punt
runners.spotlight: Won a point-to-point, best run on the track when second in 2m Limerick handicap hurdle (yielding-to-soft) at Christmas 2024; not discredited on chase debut in a handicap there last April off this mark; made an encouraging start to the season when third in a Tramore handicap in November; will not need to improve much to be involved here.

runners.comment: Bumper winner; overall hurdles form has been disappointing, no chasing experience
runners.name: Walk Away Harry
runners.spotlight: Bumper winner; fourth at Fairyhouse last February was slightly encouraging; overall hurdles form has been disappointing; no chasing experience.

runners.comment: Not badly treated by the race conditions but hard to make a strong case after Limerick run
runners.name: Way Down South
runners.spotlight: Won a point and took a maiden hurdle at the 2024 Limerick Christmas meeting; not a bad run in a handicap chase at Thurles in November; well enough treated by the race conditions but hard to make a strong case for after a remote seventh at Limerick on Monday; perhaps the headgear combination will help.

runners.comment: Third in a 16-runner contest at Navan, less exposed than many of these, worth considering
runners.name: Kellys Corner
runners.spotlight: Unplaced in two point-to-points; has run in three maiden hurdles; not beaten that far at Gowran; soundly beaten at Punchestown before a much-improved display in taking third in a 16-runner 2m3f contest at Navan 19 days ago; less exposed than many of these rivals; worth considering.

runners.comment: Rated 95 after five runs over hurdles, rider's 7lb claim is a significant asset
runners.name: Coillte M C G
runners.spotlight: Rated a respectable 95 after five runs over hurdles, the best of which was a fourth of 17 over 2m1f (good) at this venue; beaten 20l on handicap debut here; some merit in her more recent sixth in a 2m4f maiden here; rider's 7lb claim is a significant asset

runners.comment: Twice placed over fences, not certain to uphold Tramore form with Lecale's Diamond
runners.name: Mount Shenshan
runners.spotlight: Twice placed over fences in recent months; made a mistake three out when mastered by the progressive Aclass in a beginners' chase at Tramore in November; perhaps not certain to uphold form with third-placed Lecale's Diamond who was running for the first time after a break.

runners.comment: Not in the first ten in four handicap hurdles off lowly marks, huge task on chase debut
runners.name: Park Rules
runners.spotlight: Not in the first ten in four handicap hurdles off lowly marks; huge task on chase debut.

runners.comment: Quick reappearance after failure in a big handicap in which he was second last year
runners.name: Midnight Our Fred
runners.owner: Mrs Florence Lockwood & Emily B Lockwood
runners.spotlight: Good form over fences last term, winning 2m4f Gowran handicap and excellent second in the 27-runner Paddy Power at Leopardstown; pulled up in the Kim Muir at Cheltenham; started new season with second in a 3m handicap hurdle at this venue; labouring a long way from home in last Saturday's Paddy Power and was pulled up; quick reapperance.

runners.comment: Third to the excellent Wodhooh in 2025 Martin Pipe, big chance on handicap chase debut
runners.name: Raglan Road

runners.comment: Two runs over fences have been over inadequate distances, fine run over hurdles on latest
runners.name: Koori Star

runners.comment: Placed in small-field Kelso handicaps on his last two starts, needs to raise his game
runners.name: Al Kalila

runners.comment: Unplaced favourite in the 3m4f Cork National last time, respected with a valuable 7lb off
runners.name: Bal Kauto

runners.comment: Jumped badly in a hurdle race on his last run, first outing for stable in brilliant form
runners.name: Beggars Rock

runners.comment: Useful hunter chase form, flopped when well fancied for a Thurles handicap two week ago
runners.name: Milan Forth

runners.comment: Improved from seasonal debut to win narrowly at Navan, up 4lb, may remain competitive
runners.name: Soloman Lane

runners.comment: Went up 8lb for a November win, blotted his record in a Navan race won by Soloman Lane
runners.name: Battle Of Mirbat

runners.comment: Beat Soloman Lane at Gowran last January, should be better for a course run over hurdles
runners.name: Midweek Voices

runners.comment: Three-time winner has become less reliable lately, pulled up behind Soloman Lane at Navan
runners.name: Cheerful Chap

runners.comment: Bumper winner, weak jumps form, respect for the connections is the reason not to rule out
runners.name: Harbour Highway

runners.comment: Ran only once over fences in 2025, fair hurdles run lat time, 1-17 chase record a negative
runners.name: Cahirdown Boy
runners.owner: Exors Of The Late Sean Curran

15:57.race_name: Irish Stallion Farms EBF Mares (Pro/Am) INH Flat Race

runners.comment: Half-sister to three Flat winners notably the Listed-placed Lackeen, Godolphin castoff
runners.name: Country Air
runners.spotlight: Sixth foal; half-sister to three Flat winners, notably the Listed-placed Lackeen, dam ran twice, closely related to 1m 2yo Group 1 winner Ultra; 1,000gns Godolphin castoff; tongue-tie fitted.

runners.comment: Noted making some late headway when sixth of ten at Clonmel, others are more appealing
runners.name: Dlightofdsun
runners.spotlight: Noted making some late headway when sixth of ten at Clonmel; others are more appealing.

runners.breeder: M Christophe Boistier & Mme Marie-Astrid Boistier
runners.comment: Half-sister to the top-class Gerri Colombe, dam's overall stud record is not impressive
runners.name: Mary Og
runners.spotlight: Ninth foal; half-sister to the top-class Gerri Colombe; dam of little account on the track but a half-sister to useful French hurdle/chase winner Garde Chasse; of obvious interest, though the dam's overall stud record is not impressive.

runners.comment: Decent pedigree, made a pleasing introduction when 40-1 second in a bumper at Fairyhouse
runners.name: Moonverrin
runners.spotlight: Decent pedigree; made a pleasing introduction when 40-1 second in a bumper at Fairyhouse, 2 1/2l in front of the Gordon Elliott-trained favourite who won his only point-to-point start by 18l.

runners.comment: Well beaten in two maiden hurdles last June/July, no threat in two bumpers at Tramore.
runners.name: Not Leaving Yet
runners.spotlight: Failed to complete in three point-to-points; well beaten in two maiden hurdles last June/July; no threat in two bumpers at Tramore

runners.comment: Bought for E65,000 at Goresbridge last April after beating a subsequent winner in a point
runners.name: Owning Flower
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; sister to point/chase winner Largy Force, half-sister to winners Curious Times (2m/2m4f hurdle) and Emancipator (2m4f-3m hurdle/chase); bought for E65,000 at Goresbridge last April after beating a subsequent winner in a maiden point at Ballycahane in March.

runners.comment: Half-sister to bumper/hurdle winner Starzand; dam 1m6f winner, stable in superb form
runners.name: Poetic Twist
runners.spotlight: Fourth foal; half-sister to bumper/ hurdle winner Starzand; dam 1m6f winner, half-sister to winners Dancing Meadows (bumper/2m2f hurdle) and Speaker Connolly (useful 2m hurdle/2m5f chase); stable in superb form.

runners.comment: Half-sister to a pair of bumper/hurdle winners Farfromnowhere and Came From Nowhere
runners.name: Unquite Dreams
runners.spotlight: Third foal; half-sister to winners Farfromnowhere (bumper and hurdle) and Came From Nowhere (bumper/hurdle); dam unraced half-sister to bumper winner Bullfrog.

runners.comment: Picked up useful experience when third in an academy hurdle, rider booking is a positive
runners.name: Kilbarry Alexy
runners.owner: Mrs Con Okeeffe & Tadhg Osullivan & Anthony Okeeffe
runners.spotlight: Half-sister to Pat Doyle-trained 2025 bumper winner Tim Toe; dam unraced half-sister to useful hurdle/chase winner Abolitionist, out of once-raced half-sister to high-class jumper Racing Demon; picked up useful experience when third in an academy hurdle won by a rank outsider.

runners.comment: Dam an unplaced half-sister to winners El Picador (Flat/hurdle) and Weddell Sea (hurdle)
runners.name: Lest Ye Forget
runners.spotlight: Second foal; dam unplaced, half-sister to winners El Picador (Flat/hurdle) and Weddell Sea (2m hurdle).
